main event: A bright, circular object about 1/4 the size of the full moon was observed for 2-3 seconds east of Japan.
interesting points: The object had a bright white body and a red tail that was about 4 times the diameter of the body.
The tail appeared to be disengaging from the body and was also 4 times the diameter of the body.
The object arced slightly downward from an easterly direction and disappeared into the distance.
The report states the description, flight path, and duration are characteristic of a meteor, but the source claimed it was not a meteor based on their experience.
The report estimated the object was probably a meteorite or possible reentry of a space vehicle.
sighted object: a bright, circular object with a red tail
